code.displayName: Physician Assistants and Advanced Practice Nursing Providers

Relevant diagnostic tests and/or laboratory data

td.content: s:64 yo white m retired presents with mild cough of 4 weeks duration together with mild fever, Respiratory. denies any alcohol use patient reports that he smokes once or twice daily o:Height 173 cm, Weight 65.5 kg, Temperature 36.8 C, Pulse 76, SystolicBP 110, DiastolicBP 70, Respiration 16, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 3 (new patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Pulse Oximetry.

content2.Unmatched: denies any alcohol use patient reports that he smokes once or twice daily

td.content: s:pt complains of recurrent mild fever over the past month. The patient reports mild cough. patient is a white m aged 65 Ys. he has approx. a 30 pack/year history of smoking Patient reports that he never drinks alcohol o:Height 173 cm, Weight 64.7 kg, Temperature 36.7 C, Pulse 78, SystolicBP 107, DiastolicBP 66, Respiration 14, nose = no nasal congestion, wheeze-LU, Heart = RRR, Normal S1/S2, no murmurs, all lung fields a:Shortness of Breath p:performed E/M Level 2 (established patient) - Completed, and prescribed OMS - 50 DEMAND OXYGEN nasal cannula, and ordered FEV1, FEV1/FVC, Pulse Oximetry.
